info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 7 at 8:15PM MDT until July 7 at 9:45PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque NM
info.description:
At 815 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the South Fork and Salt Burn Scars. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen over each scar. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible over the eastern portions of the South Fork burn scar. Flash flooding has already been reported and additional rainfall will exacerbate existing flooding issues.
Excessive rainfall over the burn scar will impact Upper Canyon, Brady Canyon, and Perk Canyon as well as the Cedar Creek, Eagle Creek and Rio Ruidoso drainages. Impacts will include but are not limited to all nearby reservoirs, bridges, culverts and roadways. Impacts to areas along the Rio Ruidoso may extend downstream of Ruidoso Downs. The debris flow can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials.
HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding in and around the South Fork and Salt Burn Scar.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the South Fork and Salt Burn Scar.
Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Ruidoso, Ruidoso Downs, Alto, Glencoe and Hollywood.
info.instruction: This is a life threatening situation. Heavy rainfall will cause extensive and severe flash flooding of creeks, streams and ditches in the South Fork and Salt Burn Scar. Severe debris flows can also be anticipated across roads. Roads and driveways may be washed away in places. If you encounter flood waters, climb to safety.

parameter.value: FLASH FLOOD WARNING FOR THE SOUTH FORK AND SALT BURN SCAR REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR SOUTH CENTRAL LINCOLN COUNTY
